intro: Archeria racemosa, commonly known as the common redstem, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Poaceae family, commonly referred to as grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a bluish-green color, and its flowers are small, greenish, and clustered in dense panicles. Archeria racemosa is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to colonize various environments.
